intro: Clidemia epibaterium, commonly known as the creeping snowberry, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various birds and small mammals. Clidemia epibaterium thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs.
